term.name: physical directory
term.descr: The physical directory is part of the file system that contains files and directories.

term.name: file
term.descr: File of the file system. Any kind of file is possible: Mircosoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Text, PDF, mp3, vob, and links to other documents, web pages, etc.

term.name: zip directory
term.descr: Any type of supported compress or uncompressed archives.

term.name: descriptor inheritance
term.descr: A description of a physical directory is used for all documents and physical directories contained in it. Inheritance is just used if none of the included documents or physical directories have a descriptor.

term.name: shadow file
term.descr: Document that is part of a global document archive and is not deployed to the current distributed archive.

term.name: shadow descriptor
term.descr: Describes the associated file or directory. The directory or file is not part of the current deployed archive.

term.name: file deployment
term.descr: Process of exporting files and directories from the global archive.

term.name: associated file
term.descr: physical file that is described by a file descriptor.

term.name: associated directory
term.descr: physical directory of the file system that is described by a directory descriptor.

term.name: category directory
term.descr: Logical directory that is not part of the file system. The category directory is a logical categorization which is defined using a category path.

term.name: category directory descriptor
term.descr: Description of a logical category directory.

term.name: physical view
term.descr: View of the files and directories within the file system.

term.name: logical view
term.descr: View of the hierachially structure defined by category paths.

term.name: descriptor archive
term.descr: Directory or ZIP file that contains the descriptors of all files included within the physical directory and a descriptor of the physical dierectory itself.

term.name: global archive
term.descr: Archive that includes all document. It could be a virtually global archive that consists of several distributed archives.

term.name: distributed archive
term.descr: A part or a complete part of a global archive.
